sgcool_label_text:See Cheen Tee (1928 - 1996) was born in Terengganu
 Malaysia. He came to Singapore in 1947 to pursue a formal Chinese education and completed his secondary education at the Catholic High School in 1948. He then joined NAFA in 1950 and was taught by the pioneer artists which include Cheong Soo Pieng
 Chen Wen Hsi
 Chen Chong Swee and Lim Hak Tai.\r\n\r\nSee Cheen Tee was adept at various mediums which include oil painting
 watercolour
 and sculpture but he was most known for his woodcuts. He started producing black-and-white woodcuts in the mid-1950s where his depictions of the social realities of life in Malaya back then
 were amongst the finest he produced. Subsequently he started producing coloured woodblock prints from the mid-1960s. The latter were generally more decorative but his draftsmanship and illustrations continued to be of the highest quality
 if not
 more refined.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
See Cheen Tee (1928 - 1996) was born in Terengganu, Malaysia. He came to Singapore in 1947 to pursue a formal Chinese education and completed his secondary education at the Catholic High School in 1948. He then joined NAFA in 1950 and was taught by the pioneer artists which include Cheong Soo Pieng, Chen Wen Hsi, Chen Chong Swee and Lim Hak Tai.

See Cheen Tee was adept at various mediums which include oil painting, watercolour, and sculpture but he was most known for his woodcuts. He started producing black-and-white woodcuts in the mid-1950s where his depictions of the social realities of life in Malaya back then, were amongst the finest he produced. Subsequently he started producing coloured woodblock prints from the mid-1960s. The latter were generally more decorative but his draftsmanship and illustrations continued to be of the highest quality, if not, more refined.
